Fixing libcurl Configuration Error | Generated by AI

Home 2025.10

This error means the configure script is trying to find libcurl (a library for HTTP/HTTPS requests), but it cannot locate curl-config ‚Äî a helper binary that tells where libcurl is installed.

Here‚Äôs how to fix it depending on your system:

üß© For Ubuntu / Debian

Run:

sudo apt update
sudo apt install libcurl4-openssl-dev

Then try again:

./configure

üß© For Fedora / CentOS / RHEL

Run:

sudo dnf install libcurl-devel

üß© For Arch / Manjaro

Run:

sudo pacman -S curl

üîç To verify installation

After installation, make sure curl-config is available:

which curl-config

If it returns a path like /usr/bin/curl-config, you‚Äôre good.

Then rerun:

./configure
make
sudo make install
